Luckily, we've got your back and have reserved a few spots each night for foreign visitors to Tokyo. When you understand the concept, it's easy to see why it's so popular. 100 different types of sakes from all over Japan, an all-you-can-drink philosophy, BYO food (there's a nearby supermarket), and an almost open-ended duration. Not much of a sake connoisseur? The staff will be more than happy to make some suggestions. Traveling alone? Unsuprisingly, you'll be meeting and making new friends very quickly. Worried you'll drink too much? A water kanpai every hour should sort you out. It promises to be a night you'll remember..or not...

Using the traditional style and guided by a skilled instructor, make a beautiful Japanese-style towel, hand dyed with an original Japanese technique called 'Chusen'. Walk through the full manufacturing process of a craftsman, such as dyeing part of a design using various colors, washing techniques to clean off the color, and more. Depending on your schedule and budget, choose between the basic or full course.

Japanese tea culture is an art, a tradition, a symbol of culture, a ceremony. It is believed that tea ceremonies maintain a peaceful mind and wash away stress or fatigue. In this unique Japanese tea ceremony experience in Tokyo, your hosts dressed in traditional kimonos give a native insight into the importance of tea ceremonies in Japan. Watch the whole meticulous process first hand then enjoy your delicious tea accompanied by some delectable sweet treats.

strIntroduction: Appreciate the beauty of ancient and modern Japan on a Tokyo walking tour to Meiji Shrine, Imperial Palace, and the Nihonbashi business district Experience the quietly stunning beauty of Meiji Shrine built in the 1920s Discover the mysterious past of the Japanese imperial family and glimpse the splendid architectural design of the palace Stroll Nihonbashi, visit the famous bridge and soak up the prosperous atmosphere Allow your English speaking guide to better explain Tokyo's history as you tour the area Experience the quietly stunning beauty of Meiji Shrine built in the 1920s Experience the quietly stunning beauty of Meiji Shrine built in the 1920s Discover the mysterious past of the Japanese imperial family and glimpse the splendid architectural design of the palace Discover the mysterious past of the Japanese imperial family and glimpse the splendid architectural design of the palace Stroll Nihonbashi, visit the famous bridge and soak up the prosperous atmosphere Stroll Nihonbashi, visit the famous bridge and soak up the prosperous atmosphere Allow your English speaking guide to better explain Tokyo's history as you tour the area Allow your English speaking guide to better explain Tokyo's history as you tour the area What We Love:   What We Love: Tokyo's most famous Shinto shrine, Meiji Shrine, is a welcome retreat from the frenzy of Tokyo. Soak up the serence atmosphere, write wishes on paper tied to the prayer wall, or watch a wedding procession glide past. Next stop is the city's impressive Imperial Palace. Once the world's largest fortress (though little of it remains), the palace is now home to the Emperor and Imperial Family. Whilst most of the building is off limits, the grounds and East Garden are a beautiful place to stroll. Afterwards, venture into the 'center of Japan' at Tokyo's business district, Nihonbashi. A hub of shopping and dining, make sure to also walk over the area's namesake, Nihonbashi Bridge.

Dive in and out of watering holes popular with the locals, kick back with a Japanese brew and munch on favorite foods at 'Izakaya' restaurant/bars. You'll get a first hand insight into Tokyo night life and Japanese drinking culture from local establishments (no tourists here!) - Kanpai!

strIntroduction: Encounter the ancient and ornate temples and expansive grassy park, home to the famed Nara nodding deer, on this day trip to Nara from Osaka Enjoy a convenient afternoon tour of Nara from Osaka Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine Shop for mementos at Nara Nagomikan, the largest souvenir shop in Nara Enjoy a convenient afternoon tour of Nara from Osaka Enjoy a convenient afternoon tour of Nara from Osaka Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Walk the grounds of Nara Park and meet the famous deer, hundreds of which roam freely Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of ancient Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine Shop for mementos at Nara Nagomikan, the largest souvenir shop in Nara Shop for mementos at Nara Nagomikan, the largest souvenir shop in Nara What We Love:   What We Love: Providing travelers with the perfect excursion from the big city, the beautiful city of Nara (once Japan's capital) is an ideal nature escape in all seasons. Famed for the thousands of deer that graze and roam freely in the park as well as the significant temples dating from the eighth century. Once inside the park you'll visit two UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Todai-ji Temple is an iconic symbol of the Nara Period and one of the world's largest wooden structures. The huge 15-meter bronze Great Buddha is truly a sight to behold. Kasuga Taisha Shrine, built in 768 AD, is famed for its stone and bronze lanterns. Making your way to the shrine, you'll encounter a number of deer, thought to be the shrine messengers. Eternally hungry, you can purchase food to feed the deer who will thank you with their characteristic nodding!

Tour Kyoto's UNESCO-listed sites including Nijo Castle, built in 1626 to provide lodging for Tokugawa Shogun, and Kinkaku-ji Temple, or more aptly known as the Golden Pavilion for the thin layer of pure gold that covers it. Gain exclusive access to the Kyoto Imperial Palace and enjoy a delicious Japanese-style lunch. On arrival in Nara, you'll explore the beautiful green grounds and meet the famous nodding deer of Nara Park plus get the opportunity to enter the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of Todai-ji Temple (and the Great Buddha) and Kasuga Taisha Shrine. Comfortable coach transportation upon arrival in Kyoto is provided, making this a stress-free way to sightsee two cities in a day!

In only a day experience the spiritual natural beauty of Miyajima and the historic significance of Hiroshima Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Ride the iconic Shinkansen (bullet train) in both directions Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Ride the iconic Shinkansen (bullet train) in both directions Ride the iconic Shinkansen (bullet train) in both directions What We Love:   What We Love: Enlighten your previous notions of WWII with a day trip that will put into perspective the impact of the first atomic bombing. The Atomic Bomb Dome is an important element of the trip, reminding us of the destruction the bomb caused. The Dome is now preserved to promote peace and the elimination of all atomic bombs. Don't worry, the somber atmosphere doesn't stay for long. Witness the spiritual beauty of the Itsukushima Shrine. Famed as a floating shrine on the sea, Itsukushima Shrine surrounds itself by the Prussian blue sea and the picturesque virgin forest. Anyone wanting a day of wondrous sightseeing and purposeful historic learning, then give this trip a shot!

Impersonate a Samurai or Ninja and take part in a rescue mission Understand the spirit and moral principles behind 'tate-dou' (the art of sword fighting) Learn from experienced Japanese masters and dress up in traditional clothing Enjoy a 60 or 90 minute lesson with time to take photographs Impersonate a Samurai or Ninja and take part in a rescue mission Impersonate a Samurai or Ninja and take part in a rescue mission Understand the spirit and moral principles behind 'tate-dou' (the art of sword fighting) Understand the spirit and moral principles behind 'tate-dou' (the art of sword fighting) Learn from experienced Japanese masters and dress up in traditional clothing Learn from experienced Japanese masters and dress up in traditional clothing Enjoy a 60 or 90 minute lesson with time to take photographs Enjoy a 60 or 90 minute lesson with time to take photographs What We Love:   What We Love: You too can learn to become an ancient Samurai or Japanese Ninja! After a brief talk to learn the history and basics of "Tate" (sword fighting), it's over to you to try your hand at this complex art usually only taught to stage or film actors. Not only do you have to focus on correcting the moves, but your deportment, gestures, etiquette, attentiveness as well as possessing discipline of mind are equally important. Believe us, it's harder than it looks! If you're impressed by the swift movements and subtle agility of a ninja then why not try your had at throwing stars and practicing the special hand 'seals' said to bring ninjas their superhuman skills! You'll certainly feel the part dressed in traditional outfits as you act out a fight using all the moves you've just learnt. Not only will you discover traditional Japanese culture but we promise you'll feel like you've just taken part in an action movie too! Of course, they'll be plenty of time for taking photographs as well!

It is the oldest onsen (hot spring) town in Japan, founded 1300 years ago. Since the days of old, it has been well known as a timeless spa resort where Emperors, court nobles, samurai, and other great minds visited. Furthermore, the town's classic Japanese architecture and its numerous historical temples, shrines, and houses have fortunately been well preserved and make a great place to stroll through some of Japan's oldest streets and to take a dip it some ancient hot springs at the fantastic Taikou-no-yu spa. With access from Kansai International Airport and Kyoto within two hours, Arima Onsen makes for a great day trip with convenient access to the nearby cities.

Koya, the center of Shingon Buddhism. Kobo Daishi, one of Japan's most important religious figures, created the Buddhist sect in 805 and built its first temple (Garan Temple) in 826 after traveling for years to find the perfect place to ground his religion. Now over 100 temples line the streets of Koyasan. On your journey through Mt. Koya you'll eat a Buddhist vegetarian lunch in one of the mountain's famous temples and explore at your own pace and leisure. This 1-day trek is a fantastic outing for anyone craving an un-guided peaceful adventure.

Tour Kyoto's UNESCO-listed sites including Nijo Castle, built in 1626 to provide lodging for Tokugawa Shogun, and Kinkaku-ji Temple, or more aptly known as the Golden Pavilion for the thin layer of pure gold that covers it. Gain exclusive access to the Kyoto Imperial Palace and enjoy a delicious Japanese-style lunch. On arrival in Nara, you'll explore the beautiful green grounds and meet the famous nodding deer of Nara Park plus get the opportunity to enter the UNESCO World Heritage Sites of Todai-ji Temple (and the Great Buddha) and Kasuga Taisha Shrine. Comfortable coach transportation is provided, making this a stress-free way to sightsee two cities in a day!

Ride past the vibrant Yasaka Shrine and nod to geiko women and their maiko (apprentices) as they stroll through the stone laden streets of Gion adorned in delicate kimono. Cycling through these traditional districts offers an unmatchable perspective of Kyoto. Break away from cliché tours and feed your inner adventurer!

It's an ideal trip for Kyoto-first timers wanting a historically rich sweep of the city.

Add a spark to your afternoon with a trip to expertly crafted temples and a visit to the vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Walk through the characteristically vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Explore the world's longest wooden structure, Sanjusangen-do Temple Visit the Kiyomizu temple and walk through the historic shopping lane leading to its entrance Walk through the characteristically vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Walk through the characteristically vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine Explore the world's longest wooden structure, Sanjusangen-do Temple Explore the world's longest wooden structure, Sanjusangen-do Temple Visit the Kiyomizu temple and walk through the historic shopping lane leading to its entrance Visit the Kiyomizu temple and walk through the historic shopping lane leading to its entrance What We Love:   What We Love: Transform your afternoon in Kyoto into an adventure filled with expertly crafted temples and a visit to the vibrant red Heian Jingu Shrine. Stroll through the historic shopping lane on your walk to Kiyomizu-dera Temple and think of a wish to make when you reach the temple—legend says it'll come true!

Spend your evening experiencing traditional Japanese performances, a candlelight tea ceremony, a stroll through Gion Historical Preservation District and a healthy Zen-style meal Watch the traditional Japanese dances of noh, kyogen, bunraku and koto Walk around the Gion Historical Preservation district and explore the narrow streets full of old ochayas (maiko girls and geiko women performance houses) Enjoy a private candlelight tea ceremony Dine on a healthy Shojin-ryori (Buddhist vegetarian) dinner Watch the traditional Japanese dances of noh, kyogen, bunraku and koto Watch the traditional Japanese dances of noh, kyogen, bunraku and koto Walk around the Gion Historical Preservation district and explore the narrow streets full of old ochayas (maiko girls and geiko women performance houses) Walk around the Gion Historical Preservation district and explore the narrow streets full of old ochayas (maiko girls and geiko women performance houses) Enjoy a private candlelight tea ceremony Enjoy a private candlelight tea ceremony Dine on a healthy Shojin-ryori (Buddhist vegetarian) dinner Dine on a healthy Shojin-ryori (Buddhist vegetarian) dinner What We Love:   What We Love: Transform your evening with a traditional Japanese experience filled with performances, a candlelit tea ceremony and a Zen-style dinner. Experience the authentic dance styles of noh, kyogen, bunraku and koto all in one night. Stroll through the Gion Historical Preservation District and notice the narrow streets and ochayas (maiko and geiko performance houses). Your private tea ceremony is held under candlelight at Yoshi-ima Ryokan's tea ceremony room in Kurenaitei. Wind down the day with Shojin-ryori (Buddhist style cuisine) and enjoy vegetarian dishes cooked to perfection.

In only a day experience the spiritual natural beauty of Miyajima and the historic significance of Hiroshima Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Visit the Itsukushima Shrine and behold its picturesque beauty as it sits upon the sea Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Discover the terror behind the atomic bomb at the Hiroshima Peace Museum Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome Gaze upon the Atomic Bomb Dome and witness the disastrous outcome of the first atomic bombing during WWII and uncover the promotion of peace brought through preserving the dome What We Love:   What We Love: Enlighten your previous notions of WWII with a day trip that will put into perspective the impact of the first atomic bombing. The Atomic Bomb Dome is an important element of the trip, reminding us of the destruction the bomb caused. The Dome is now preserved to promote peace and the elimination of all atomic bombs. Don't worry, the somber atmosphere doesn't continue for long as you witness the spiritual beauty of the Itsukushima Shrine. Famed as a floating shrine on the sea, Itsukushima Shrine surrounds itself by the Prussian blue sea and the picturesque virgin forest. Anyone wanting a day of wondrous sightseeing and purposeful historic learning, then give this trip a shot!

strIntroduction: Learn the tricks to making traditional Japanese dishes from your enthusiastic instructor, prepare your own authentic lunch and discover the cultural background of the famous Japanese bento. Wear traditonal buddhist monk clothing to embrace the cultural experience Prepare 4-5 dishes to make a full bento lunch box Learn about dashi broth (soup stock for Japanese cuisine) and various types of seasonings (soy sauce, mirin, sake, miso, etc) from your expert instructor Enjoy a sociable, home-made lunch with your classmates For another unique Japanese cooking class in the afternoon, try out our Kappa cooking course too! Kappa cooking course What We Love:   What We Love: Ever wondered how Japanese chefs manage to pack so many interesting flavors into the tiny treats in a bento box? Come along to a traditional cooking class to learn the tricks of the trade from expert local chefs. The sessions provide a fun and interactive environment for learning about the preparation of sushi, sesame salads and many other specialities. Your teachers will also offer you an insight into the historical background of 'Bento', and you'll be able to dress in sumae (the traditional dress of a working buddhist monk) to complete your cultural experience. After you've spent the morning perfecting your cooking skills, you'll feast upon your mini creations as you get to know the fellow chefs on your course. It's a fun filled morning of cultural discovery - foodies, don't miss out!

It's a fun filled afternoon of cultural and culinary exploration - foodies, this one's for you!

Visit the famous Fushimi Inari Shrine, stroll through the cellars of sake barrels and take a sip of some traditionally-made sake Discover the original sake brewing techniques and traditions Have a taste of the finest sake made from naturally purified spring water flowing from Fushimi Hill (optional) Stroll through the iconic orange gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine Experienced English speaking guide services plus hotel pick up included Discover the original sake brewing techniques and traditions Have a taste of the finest sake made from naturally purified spring water flowing from Fushimi Hill (optional) Stroll through the iconic orange gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine Experienced English speaking guide services plus hotel pick up included What We Love:   What We Love: As is often the case, modern technology often leaves ancient traditions behind and the original art is lost. On this tour, that's not the case! Go back in time on a journey to see the original sake making process. Wander through the depths of sake cellars, taste-test the unique flavors and discover the authentic techniques used in brewing Japan's beloved rice wine beverage, a tradition preserved for over 1000 years. Complete with experience with a visit to the iconic orange torii gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine, one of Kyoto's most iconic landmarks in a tranquil forest setting.

strIntroduction: Take a guided walk around Okochi Mountain Villa, Togetsukyo Bridge and other prominent locations in Arashiyama near Kyoto Visit Nonomiya Shrine, a popular place for single people to pray for marriage See Tenryuji Temple, one of Kyoto’s most beautiful Zen temples Enjoy a relaxing stroll through the extensive bamboo grove that stretches as far as the eye can see Learn more about the places from government licensed tour guides who are both friendly and dedicated to helping you Visit Nonomiya Shrine, a popular place for single people to pray for marriage See Tenryuji Temple, one of Kyoto’s most beautiful Zen temples Enjoy a relaxing stroll through the extensive bamboo grove that stretches as far as the eye can see Learn more about the places from government licensed tour guides who are both friendly and dedicated to helping you What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the western outskirts of Kyoto, Arashiyama is famed for its beautiful scenery and well-preserved ancient royal court. Enter the former villa of late actor Okochi Denjiro, the Okochi Sanso Villa – take a stroll through the traditional Japanese garden rumored to be built by Denjiro as a picture of everlasting beauty (not the deteriorating beauty captured on film). Explore one of Kyoto's great Zen temples, the Tenryuji Temple – built in 1339 by the shogun Ashikaga Takauji in honor of the late Emperor Godaigo, with a number of vantage points offering the best views of Arashiyama. Complete your journey at iconic Togetsukyo Bridge, the 'Moon Crossing Bridge', known for beautiful reflections in the Oi River.
strTitle: Arashiyama Bamboo Forest Half Day Tour

strIntroduction: Take a break from temple hopping to discover the diverse local food and retail culture of Kyoto Browse for foods, tea, cooking utensils and more at Nishiki Market's 130 shops! Witness the coexistence of traditional and modern retail culture on Teramachi Street Visit Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine, dedicated to academics and business Let your English speaking guide share fascinating facts about the area and pick out the best shops Browse for foods, tea, cooking utensils and more at Nishiki Market's 130 shops! Witness the coexistence of traditional and modern retail culture on Teramachi Street Visit Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine, dedicated to academics and business Let your English speaking guide share fascinating facts about the area and pick out the best shops What We Love:   What We Love: Start your morning amongst the bustle and hustle of Nishiki Market, a traditional Japanese market home to an assortment of food products and over a hundred shops selling fresh seafood, seasonal produce and cookware – it's no wonder it's known as 'Kyoto's kitchen'! Our recommendation? Try the soymilk of Senmaruya, a vital ingredient for Kyoto home cooking, with a history of over 210 years. You might find your visit to Teramachi Kyogoku Street somewhat bemusing: the confluence of historical and modern results in the big fashion brands like Louis Vuitton nestled comfortably beside the traditional shops like woodblock painting store Daishodo. This tour is the perfect fusion of cultural experience...and retail therapy session!

Stroll along the oldest streets of Kyoto and learn about the lives of geishas Visit three Geisha districts in Kyoto - Gojyorakuen, Miyagawacho and Gion Learn about the process of becoming a Geisha and their daily lives Enter Kaikado, the shop with the longest history in producing handmade tea caddies and Kenninji, the oldest Zen temple which is known to be the birthplace of Japanese green tea Visit Tatsumi Inari Shrine, where girls pray to become accomplished geisha and famous names are etched into the structure Visit three Geisha districts in Kyoto - Gojyorakuen, Miyagawacho and Gion Learn about the process of becoming a Geisha and their daily lives Enter Kaikado, the shop with the longest history in producing handmade tea caddies and Kenninji, the oldest Zen temple which is known to be the birthplace of Japanese green tea Visit Tatsumi Inari Shrine, where girls pray to become accomplished geisha and famous names are etched into the structure What We Love:   What We Love: Take a walk down the three most famous geisha districts in Kyoto where you will pay a visit to establishments significant to the city's rich history. Stroll along the pathways of Gojyorakuen, once the most notorious red light district, before visiting Miyagawacho, known for geisha with talents for Japanese dance. The respectable geisha profession is often misrepresented - this tour aims to correct any misinformation. As you stroll the streets of Gion, your guide will explain all about what being a geisha means as you pass by boarding residences and entertainment houses. You may hear the faint tunes of geisha practising their musical skills or watch as a beautifully dressed geisha hurries over cobbled streets and ornate bridges to her next appointment. You'll also see the oldest Zen temple in Kyoto, also the birthplace of Japanese green tea, and a shrine with famous celebrities and geisha etched in the red posts.

Spend quality time with nature as you visit lush green gardens together with your guide or enjoy gliding through parts of the iconic Arashiyama bamboo forest leading to a popular shrine in its midst. Let the 'Zen' spirit bring your body to perfect harmony as you gaze upon the splendid temple architecture and tranquil forest, feeling like true nobility as you enjoy the services of an enthusiastic tour guide from your rickshaw seat.

Riding through the narrow streets, along the wooden houses and traditional shops of old Kyoto, the rickshaw rides are a perfect way to tour the majesty of Higashiyama whilst also treating a loved one in style.

It's the Octopus Card in Hong Kong, Easy Card in Taiwan, Suica Card in Tokyo, and for the Kansai region it's the ICOCA Card. A play on the phrase 'Iko ka' (行こか) meaning 'Shall we go?' in the local dialect, the card covers the major cities of the Kansai region including Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe. With one swipe of the contactless card, you can seamlessly hop aboard metros, buses, trains or even pay for your shopping. The card is handily preloaded with 1,500 yen credit, plus the 500 yen deposit so it's ready to use as soon as you pick it up.

strIntroduction: Travel by bus to discover both the old and newer side to Hokkaido's most populous city. Guided headsets, stops at a number of places of interest and historic monuments - the ideal city tour! Take in the historic sights and discover one of Japan's trendiest cities Stop off at the intriguing Hokkaido Shrine and discover local Sapporo at the city's famous wholesale market Drive by the iconic Sapporo Tower, standing an impressive 147 meters high, from the grounds of nearby Odori Park Choose from English, Chinese or Korean on your own personal headset to accompany the tour and learn more about the city Take in the historic sights and discover one of Japan's trendiest cities Stop off at the intriguing Hokkaido Shrine and discover local Sapporo at the city's famous wholesale market Drive by the iconic Sapporo Tower, standing an impressive 147 meters high, from the grounds of nearby Odori Park Choose from English, Chinese or Korean on your own personal headset to accompany the tour and learn more about the city What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy the historic sights of Sapporo as well as some other charms of one of Japan's most vibrant cities on a half-day morning bus tour. Discover some of Sapporo's older sights such as the Hokkaido Shrine where three sacred deities are enshrined, and stroll the grounds taking in the iconic cherry blossom gardens. Next up is the city's iconic Shiroi Koibito Park, famed for its confectionary production. See up close how this well-known Hokkaido export is made, and be sure to have a taste before ending the tour in the bustling Central Wholesale Market. With old and modern Sapporo both covered, this tour is ideal for those wanting to get a deeper understanding of one of Japan's most happening cities.

Perfect for discovering this fantastic city, the tour will take you around a number of must-visit attractions such as the ancient Hokkaido Shrine, and Odori Park, famed for its iconic cherry blossom. Next up head to the Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill and the Okurayama Ski Jump Stadium before turning back to the bright lights of the city and visiting the Sapporo Dome, perhaps one of the most iconic stadia built for when Japan co-hosted the Football World Cup in 2002. An all-round adventure and the perfect way to be introduced to this great city!

strIntroduction: Take in the sweeping views of stunning Sapporo from the thrilling observation deck, 90 meters in the sky Don't miss the Sapporo TV Tower beautifully lit up at night (click here for the latest light up schedule) The best viewing point for incredible unrestricted views of the Sea of Japan and Ishikari Heigen Located next to Odori Park - a popular destination for local Hokkaido residents to relax and unwind Complimentary WiFi is available at the observation deck Don't miss the Sapporo TV Tower beautifully lit up at night (click here for the latest light up schedule) click here The best viewing point for incredible unrestricted views of the Sea of Japan and Ishikari Heigen Located next to Odori Park - a popular destination for local Hokkaido residents to relax and unwind Complimentary WiFi is available at the observation deck What We Love:   What We Love: Built in 1957, the Sapporo TV Tower is one of the city's iconic landmarks. Standing 147.2 meters tall, the tower is a standout feature on the Sapporo skyline and a visit to the observation deck offers guests totally unobstructed 360 views to take in the beauty of one of Japan's greenest cities. It is 60 seconds by elevator from the third floor to the observation deck 90.38 meters above ground giving a dramatic bird's eye view of Sapporo. Set to a background of the magnificent Ishikari countryside, the far afield Japan Sea, and Odori Park where flowers bloom in the four seasons, this experience is a must-do when in Hokkaido's biggest and most vibrant city.
